meanings.definition: A substance used to fill cracks or holes in walls.
meanings.sent1: I used spackling to fix the hole in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The painter applied spackling to the cracked wall.
meanings.sent3: The spackling decided to take a break from filling holes and cracks.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room like spackling fills cracks.
meanings.sent5: The spackling gleamed under the bright light, ready to repair any imperfections.

meanings.definition: To fill cracks or holes with spackling.
meanings.sent1: She carefully spackled the crack in the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: The handyman is spackling the wall to make it smooth.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to help by spackling the hole with its paws.
meanings.sent4: His words spackled the broken relationship, bringing them closer.
meanings.sent5: The chef spackled the cake layers together with precision and care.
